name: Spiced Sweet Potato Black Bean Burger
description: I love to make a great big batch of these vegan 'burgers' so I can keep some in the freezer for fast dinners on busy nights.

recipeInstructions.text: In the bowl of a food processor add onion, garlic, carrots, celery, serrano, and corn kernels and process until the vegetables are chopped finely but not pureed.
recipeInstructions.name: In the bowl of a food processor add onion, garlic, carrots, celery, serrano, and corn kernels and process until the vegetables are chopped finely but not pureed.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, set to medium-low heat, sauté vegetable mixture until all of the liquid has evaporated, about 5 – 7 minutes. Set aside and let cool for 5 min.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan, set to medium-low heat, sauté vegetable mixture until all of the liquid has evaporated, about 5 – 7 minutes. Set aside and let cool for 5 min.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl combine brown rice, quinoa, beans, sweet potato, garam masala, paprika, corn flour, parsley, vegetable mixture, salt, and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl combine brown rice, quinoa, beans, sweet potato, garam masala, paprika, corn flour, parsley, vegetable mixture, salt, and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Place half of the mixture back into the food processor and pulse 3 times. Return mixture to bowl and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Place half of the mixture back into the food processor and pulse 3 times. Return mixture to bowl and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Form into patties. Refrigerate for at least an hour before cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Form into patties. Refrigerate for at least an hour before cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: To cook, sauté in 1 tbsp. of oil for 2 -3 min. on each side until golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: To cook, sauté in 1 tbsp. of oil for 2 -3 min. on each side until golden brown.

keywords: sweet potato black bean burger, vegan black bean burger
